p: The biosynthesis of secondary metabolites in medicinal and aromatic plants depends on genetic, physiological, soil and environmental factors [ 28] and, in particular, it can be significantly affected by the symbiotic association between arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi (AMF) and roots [ 29]. A confirmation of the latter phenomenon was reported by Huang et al. [ 30] upon Glomus mosseae inoculation in Artemisia annua.
